required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Nevirapine or Atazanavir/Ritonavir Given With Emtricitabine/Tenofovir in Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV)-1-infected Treatment Naive Adults
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Open Label Study Evaluating the Lipid Profile Difference and Efficacy of a Combined Therapy Including Tenofovir, Emtricitabine + Atazanavir / r or NVP in Naive HIV - 1 Infected Patients.

brief_summary.textblock:
Primary purpose of this study is to compare the efficacy and safety of two different nevirapine (Viramune) dosing regimens (once daily (QD) and twice daily (BID) application) and of atazanavir/ritonavir (Reyataz/Norvir), all on an emtricitabine/tenofovir disoproxil fumarate (DF) (Truvada) background. Patients will receive either nevirapine (NVP) 200 mg twice daily, or NVP 400 mg once daily , or ritonavir-boosted atazanavir (ATZ/r), all in combination with emtricitabine (FTC) and tenofovir DF (TDF).
All patients receiving NVP will start at 200 mg once daily for 2 weeks, because it has been demonstrated that this lead-in dosing regimen reduces the frequency of NVP-induced rash. At Visit 3 (Week 2), patients increase the NVP dose to either 200 mg twice daily or to 400 mg once daily. Patients receiving ATZ/r will be treated with ATZ 300 mg once daily, boosted by 100 mg ritonavir (RTV) once daily. Background antiretroviral therapy for all patients consists of one tablet of Truvada. Treatment duration is 48 weeks (primary endpoint) with an extension to 144 weeks. Patients may also participate in the metabolic sub-study, comparing NVP and ATZ/r for signs and symptoms of lipodystrophy and serum lipid/glycaemic abnormalities.

primary_outcome.description: Treatment response is defined as a viral load (VL) <50 copies/mL measured at two consecutive visits prior to Week 48 and without subsequent rebound or change of antiretroviral (ARV) therapy prior to Week 48.

secondary_outcome.measure: Treatment Response at Week 48 (TLOVR Algorithm)
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment response is defined as a VL <50 copies/mL measured at two consecutive visits up to Week 48 and without subsequent rebound or change of ARV therapy up to Week 48, based on time to loss of virologic response (TLOVR) algorithm, as a sensitivity analysis for the primary analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Patients With VL < 50 Copies/ml
secondary_outcome.description: VL <50 copies/mL among observed patients on treatment at each visit, with the final visit at Week 144 or end of trial (EOT) for the patient

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Patients With VL < 400 Copies/ml
secondary_outcome.description: VL <400 copies/mL among observed patients on treatment at each visit, with the final visit at Week 144 or end of trial (EOT)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in CD4+ Count From Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Change in CD4+ cell count from baseline among patients on treatment at each visit, with the final visit at Week 144 or EOT

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Framingham Score From Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Change in the estimated risk of cardiovascular disease using the Framingham algorithm from baseline to after 48, 96 and 144 weeks, last observation carried forward (LOCF). The score is based on age, gender, systolic blood pressure, total cholesterol, high density lipoprotein cholesterol and smoking status. Scores range from 0 to 21 with higher scores indicating a greater risk.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Mental Health Summary (MHS) Score From Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life (QoL) assessment by change in MHS score from baseline to after 48, 96 and 144 weeks (observed cases), from the Medical Outcomes Study HIV Health Survey (MOS-HIV), a 35-item self-administered questionnaire including 10 scales covering: health perceptions, pain, physical functioning, role functioning, social and cognitive functioning, mental health, energy/fatigue, health distress, and QoL. The MHS is a weighted average of the 10 scales and ranges from 0 to 100 with higher scores indicating better QoL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Physical Health Summary (PHS) Score From Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: QoL assessment by change in PHS score from baseline to after 48, 96 and 144 weeks (observed cases), from the MOS-HIV, a 35-item self-administered questionnaire including 10 scales covering: health perceptions, pain, physical functioning, role functioning, social and cognitive functioning, mental health, energy/fatigue, health distress, and QoL. The PHS is a weighted average of the 10 scales and ranges from 0 to 100 with higher scores indicating better QoL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients Hospitalized
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to Week 24, Week 24 to 48, Week 48 to 96, and Week 96 to 144/EOT
secondary_outcome.description: Cost effectiveness assessment by number of patients hospitalized

secondary_outcome.measure: Non-scheduled Physician Visits
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to Week 24, Week 24 to 48, Week 48 to 96, and Week 96 to 144/EOT
secondary_outcome.description: Cost effectiveness assessment by number of patients with non-scheduled physician visits

secondary_outcome.measure: Genotypic Resistance Associated With Virologic Failure
secondary_outcome.description: Number of treatment-emergent drug-associated substitutions in patients with virological failure up to Week 48. The total number of genotypic mutations in those patients who were virologic failures is given, not the number of patients with mutations.

secondary_outcome.measure: Treatment-emergent AIDS-defining Illness
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment-emergent AIDS-defining illness (tr.-emerg. AIDS-def.illness) including worsening during treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Treatment-emergent AIDS-defining Illness Leading to Death
secondary_outcome.description: Patients with an AIDS-defining illness leading to death broken out by treatment. Statistical analysis shows time to death from AIDS-defining illness.

secondary_outcome.measure: Lipodystrophy
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with AE lipodystrophy

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum Lipid Abnormalities
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with AE elevated serum lipids (i.e. hypercholesterolaemia)

secondary_outcome.measure: Glycaemic Abnormalities
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with AE elevated serum glucose

secondary_outcome.measure: Treatment Response at Week 96
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment response is defined as a viral load (VL) <50 copies/mL measured at two consecutive visits prior to Week 96 and without subsequent rebound or change of antiretroviral (ARV) therapy prior to Week 96.

secondary_outcome.measure: Treatment Response at Week 144
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment response is defined as a viral load (VL) <50 copies/mL measured at two consecutive visits prior to Week 144 and without subsequent rebound or change of antiretroviral (ARV) therapy prior to Week 144.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Patients With Virological Rebound With VL >=50 Copies/mL After CVR (Confirmed Virological Response) at Week 24, 48, 96, 144
secondary_outcome.description: The analyses of virologic rebound were performed on the original values at each visit(ORGV) rather than calculated results within time windows (CAL)

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Patients With Virological Rebound With VL >=400 Copies/mL After CVR at Week 24, 48, 96, 144
secondary_outcome.description: The analyses of virologic rebound were performed on the original values at each visit(ORGV) rather than calculated results within time windows (CAL)

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Patients With Virologic Failure at Week 48, 96, 144
Time to Treatment Response (First Confirmed VL<50 Copies/mL)
secondary_outcome.description: Time to treatment response was defined as the time from start of treatment until the first measurement of the first confirmed virological response

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Loss of Virologic Response (Rebound)
secondary_outcome.description: Time to loss of virologic response (TLOVR) was defined as the time from start of treatment to the first measurement showing VL ≥ 50 copies/mL in the first virologic rebound, after having a confirmed virological response.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Treatment Failure
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment failure is defined as the occurrence of the first of at least one of the following events: early discontinuation of trial drug, change in ARV therapy, failure to achieve an HIV RNA count < 50 copies/mL up to Visit 10 (week 48) or loss of virologic response

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the Calculated Glomerular Filtration Rate (GFR) at Week 48, 96 and 144
secondary_outcome.description: Calculations based on the MDRD algorithm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Patients With >= DAIDS Grade 2 Laboratory Abnormalities
Proportion of Patients Reporting Rash of Any Severity
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of Patients reporting rash of any severity

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Patients Reporting Hepatic Events of Any Severity
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of Patients reporting hepatic events of any severity

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Patients Reporting CNS (Central Nervous System) Side Effects of Any Severity
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of Patients reporting CNS (central nervous system) side effects of any severity

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of Cholesterol Values From Baseline to Week 48, 96, 144
secondary_outcome.description: Changes frombaseline in total cholesterol, LDL-cholesterol(LDL-c) and HDL

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes of Apolipoprotein Values From Baseline to Week 48, 96, 144
secondary_outcome.description: Changes frombaseline apolipoprotein A1 & B

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of hsCRP From Baseline to Week 48, 96, 144
secondary_outcome.description: Change of hsCRP from baseline to week 48, 96, 144

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of Total Triglycerides From Baseline to Week 48, 96, 144
secondary_outcome.description: Change of total triglycerides from baseline to week 48, 96, 144

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of Total Cholesterol to HDL-cholesterol Ratio From Baseline to Week 48, 96, 144
secondary_outcome.description: Change of Total cholesterol to HDL-cholesterol ratio from baseline to week 48, 96, 144

arm_group.description: nevirapine (NVP) 200 mg BID in combination with emtricitabine (FTC) and tenofovir DF (TDF)
nevirapine (NVP) 400 mg QD in combination with emtricitabine (FTC) and tenofovir DF (TDF)
ritonavir-boosted atazanavir in combination with emtricitabine (FTC) and tenofovir DF (TDF)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Signed informed consent in accordance with Good Clinical Practice (GCP) and local regulatory requirements prior to trial participation
2. HIV-1-infected males or females >= 18 years of age with positive serology confirmed by Western blot
3. No previous antiretroviral treatment (of more than 7 days)
4. Males with CD4+ counts of < 400 cells/mm3 and females with CD4+ counts of < 250 cells/mm3
5. NVP- and ATZ/r susceptibility based on HIV-1 genotypic resistance report
6. Adequate renal function defined as a calculated creatinine clearance (CLCr) >= 50 ml/min according to the Cockcroft-Gault formula
7. Karnofsky score >= 70
8. Acceptable medical history, as assessed by the investigator
Exclusion criteria:
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Active drug abuse or chronic alcoholism at the investigator's discretion
2. Hepatic cirrhosis stage Child-Pugh B or C
3. Female patients of child-bearing potential who:
- have a positive serum pregnancy test at screening or during the study,
- are breast feeding,
- are planning to become pregnant,
- are not willing to use a barrier method of contraception, or are not willing to use methods of contraception other than ethinyl estradiol containing oral contraceptives
4. Laboratory parameters Division of Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome (DAIDS) > grade 2 (triglycerides > DAIDS grade 3; total cholesterol no restrictions)
5. Active hepatitis B or C disease, defined as HBsAg-positive or Hepatitis C-Virus-Ribo Nucleic Acid (HCV-RNA)- positive with Aspartate Transaminase/Alanine Transaminase (AST/ALT) > 2.5x Upper Limit of Normal (ULN) (DAIDS grade 1)
6. Hypersensitivity to any ingredients of the test products
7. Have therapy with nephrotoxic drugs (e.g., aminoglycosides, amphotericin B, vancomycin, cidofovir, foscarnet, cisplatin, pentamidine, tacrolimus, cyclosporine) or potential competitors of renal excretion (e.g., cidofovir, acyclovir, valacyclovir, ganciclovir, valganciclovir, probenecid, high-dose non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (i.e., ibuprofen)) within 3 months prior to study screening or are expected to receive these during the study
8. Patients who are receiving other concomitant treatments which are not permitted
9. Use of other investigational medications within 30 days before study entry or during the trial
10. Use of immunomodulatory drugs within 30 days before study entry or during the trial (e.g., interferon, cyclosporin, hydroxyurea, interleukin 2, chronic treatment with prednisone)
11. Patients with Progressive Multifocal Leukoencephalopathy (PML), Visceral Kaposi's Sarcoma (KS), and/or any lymphoma
12. Any AIDS defining illness that is unresolved, symptomatic or not stable on treatment for at least 12 weeks at screening visit
13. Patients who are receiving systemic treatment for malignant disease

outcome.title: Treatment Response at Week 96
outcome.description: Treatment response is defined as a viral load (VL) <50 copies/mL measured at two consecutive visits prior to Week 96 and without subsequent rebound or change of antiretroviral (ARV) therapy prior to Week 96.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS) defined as all randomized and treated patients but numbers are reduced as indicated due to empty cells in analyses adjusting for baseline categories

outcome.title: Proportion of Patients With Virological Rebound With VL >=50 Copies/mL After CVR (Confirmed Virological Response) at Week 24, 48, 96, 144
outcome.description: The analyses of virologic rebound were performed on the original values at each visit(ORGV) rather than calculated results within time windows (CAL)
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS) defined as all randomized and treated patients.

analysis.groups_desc: Cox regression on responders only (N=289 in Nevirapine QD+BID and N=175 in Atazanvir/ritonavir)

outcome.title: Time to Loss of Virologic Response (Rebound)
outcome.description: Time to loss of virologic response (TLOVR) was defined as the time from start of treatment to the first measurement showing VL ≥ 50 copies/mL in the first virologic rebound, after having a confirmed virological response.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS) defined as all randomized and treated patients but numbers are reduced as indicated due to empty cells in analyses adjusting for baseline categories

outcome.title: Time to Treatment Failure
outcome.description: Treatment failure is defined as the occurrence of the first of at least one of the following events: early discontinuation of trial drug, change in ARV therapy, failure to achieve an HIV RNA count < 50 copies/mL up to Visit 10 (week 48) or loss of virologic response
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS) defined as all randomized and treated patients but numbers are reduced as indicated due to empty cells in analyses adjusting for baseline categories

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Other - Any publication of the result of this trial must be consistent with the Boehringer Ingelheim publication policy. The rights of the investigator and of the sponsor with regard to publication of the results of this trial are described in the investigator contract.
